intro: Dombeya befotakensis var. vestita, commonly known as the white dombeya, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes in South America. It is characterized by its showy, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the spring and early summer. The plant has simple, lance-shaped leaves that are hairy, giving it a distinctive texture. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous regions with well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens in temperate climates.
